Articles.Content:
Hi guys.

I got the demo today but I have an issue with the display. Running Mac OSX 10.9.2

It's showing up with loads of 'A's on the settings screens and the main game window, any ideas? Thank you

Edited February 17, 2015 by Master Tao
fix image link

That's... odd. Looks like a missing font.

Where do you have KSP installed?

Have you tried reinstalling (preferably from a fresh download)?

What language is your OS set to?

Can you upload a copy of your Player.log after running the demo again? It's located at ~/Library/Logs/Unity/Player.log, which you can access from Finder > Go > (hold Alt) Library.
Check your fonts -- try reinstalling them.

Opps!

Sorry guys I just remembered I deleted a load of system fonts a while back as it was messing up my ability to quickly use the ones I've downloaded for PS! Ah. Erm.

Any idea on what system fonts Kerbal uses? I'm really, really useless with this.

- - - Updated - - -

I did try reinstalling again, and it's currently installed to a folder on my desktop

I can find the logs in the library but not the Unity/player.log

I tried searching for it in the finder but with no luck :S

Off the top of my head, I couldn't tell you what all the fonts are. I'd guess Arial and Arial Bold are the problems here based on this old issue.

It sounds like you found the Logs folder in ~/Library. What's inside the Logs folder?

Literally nothing! Just an empty folder. It's a bit weird.

- - - Updated - - -

Ah! I've managed to sort it, thank you for your help. I found the option to reinstall the fonts. (I usually use a PC) ha.

Cheers!
